result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose M Soto-Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the agent but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment.

Obtain GED or HSSD. Maintain employment.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

  Do not operate a motor vehicle until properly reinstated in Wisconsin.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Comply with aftercare.
.

.

.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with anyone involved with using or trafficking illicit drugs or controlled substances

The defendant is not to be at any place where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used, sold or distributed
.

Any unpaid Court costs/fees are REMITTED by the Court

Undergo any assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

Comply with all other conditions left up to discretion of the PO

Pay DOC Supervision fees

- Extended Supervision is 4 yrs w/ conditions:  Undergo any assessments or evaluations deemed approp by the PO and follow-thru w/ any treatment recommended;  Obtain GED;  Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  No Contact w/ anyone involved in using or trafficking illicit drugs or cont subs;  Def is not to be at any place where illicit drugs or cont subs are kept, used, sold or distributed;  CRT REMITS any Crt costs/fees on this case;  Comply w/ all other conditions left up to discretion of the PO;  Pay DOC fees

from Def   re: req for sig bond to address medical issues
PER EML;  This was addressed on 10-14-15.  Copy to DA & Atty Rantke
for Modification of Bond

3:38 pm Def in court w/ Atty S. Joseph Randtke.  Def in custody.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Randtke:  I don't think he was intentionally non-compliant with probation.  He made all of his appointments...  He was also in custody for 3 weeks and they didn't meet with him.  He went to see his agent and they wouldn't see him and didn't give him a new date.  After multiple attempts, I finally got a hold of his agent.  He was assigned a new agent.  He's always kept in contact and been in town....   I don't think the PSI is a fair characterizaton of him.  He's in jail and in constant pain.  We're requesting that he get to the hospital.  I know he's got new cases.  He's asking to have his bond reinstated.  He's never been a flight risk.  Soto-Guzman comments.  Hynek:  He's had so many chances this year and has messed.  He's only concerned with his pain and daughter when he's in front of you...  These charges have been pending since the first of this year.  He continues to pick up charges.  The cash bonds are appropriate.  Nothing should be modified at this time.
COURT is aware that the issues with probation and parole are problematic.   Multiple open files.  Minimun high risk.  I think that what I did was correct as well.  If you want to get the sentencing moved up, Mr. Randtke, you can.  Bonds to remain.

Request for Modification or Change in Sentence filed

3:45 pm No appearance by Def - Atty S. Joseph Randtke present.  Emily Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Randtke states his client is in Rochester right now.  He contacted me about 8 times today saying his ride fell through but he got another ride.  He can't get here before the close of business today.
CC tomorrow at 1:30 pm.  He's also to see his PO to get an appointment for an updated PSI.  All of the info is not in there.
